title: “Power budget” is a lie.
body:
You cannot look me straight in the eye and tell me that a champion like say. Annie, has the same “power budget” as someone like say ekko. 

Ekko when played to even an acceptable level does EVERYTHING Annie does either just as well as her, or better than her, and then does more. 



And no, before anyone says it, this is not a hit piece on ekko as much as I hate him, it’s just pointing out riots insane inconsistency when making champions.

If we're talking personal combat power then it's obvious champions like Zed and Orianna have vastly different sized power budgets...
But if we add "usefulness in a teamfight" to our budget considerations then they actually don't.

All champions are balanced to have nearly 50% Win Rate, so champions like Zed whose kit is less useful in a teamfight tend to get absolutely overloaded with damage and mobility to the point that they can one combo squishies without using their ults... this is unavoidable so long as Riot's balance team wants non-teamwork-oriented champions to be on even footing (winrate-wise) with teamwork-oriented champs.
This is also why Qiyana has far less damage than a typical assassin - if she had just as much then her WR would be sky high due to the large amount of teamfight utility her ult brings.

IMO the assassin playstyle is a selfish one that has more place in battle royale solos than a teamwork game like League of Legends... but I can see why Riot would cater to it from a business perspective. A broader player base means healthier queues and fatter paychecks.
